revised_title: Temperature Measurements of Shock Waves and Detonations by Spectrum-Line Reversal: Development of Detonations
tldr: The authors studied the temperature distribution behind shock fronts and detonations in various gas mixtures using the spectrum-line reversal method. They observed five types of records, including fully established detonations and detonations with temperature steps during the flow period. The experiments were conducted using a shock tube with simultaneous measurements of gas pressure, shock speed, light emission, and the spectrum of emitted light. The results provide insights into the initiation and development of detonations.
